item.title: US, Japan, South Korea Blame North Korean Hackers for $660M Crypto Heists
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The US, Japan, and South Korea say North Korean hackers stole roughly $660 million in cryptocurrency last year.

The post US, Japan, South Korea Blame North Korean Hackers for $660M Crypto Heists appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of January 13, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of January 13, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: Ivanti Patches Critical Vulnerabilities in Endpoint Manager
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Ivanti has released patches for multiple vulnerabilities in Endpoint Manager (EPM), including four critical-severity flaws.

The post Ivanti Patches Critical Vulnerabilities in Endpoint Manager appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Fortinet Confirms New Zero-Day Exploitation
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Fortinet patches critical vulnerabilities, including a zero-day that has been exploited in the wild since at least November 2024. 

The post Fortinet Confirms New Zero-Day Exploitation  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: ICS Patch Tuesday: Security Advisories Published by Schneider, Siemens, Phoenix Contact, CISA
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Schneider Electric, Siemens, CISA, and Phoenix Contact have released January 2025 Patch Tuesday ICS security advisories.

The post ICS Patch Tuesday: Security Advisories Published by Schneider, Siemens, Phoenix Contact, CISA appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Adobe: Critical Code Execution Flaws in Photoshop
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
Patch Tuesday: Adobe ships patches for more than a dozen security defects in a wide range of software products.

The post Adobe: Critical Code Execution Flaws in Photoshop appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Microsoft Patches Trio of Exploited Windows Hyper-V Zero-Days
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
Patch Tuesday: Microsoft's January Patch Tuesday rollout includes fixes for 160 security defects, the largest number of CVEs addressed in any single month since at least 2017.

The post Microsoft Patches Trio of Exploited Windows Hyper-V Zero-Days appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Biden Signs Executive Order Aimed at Growing AI Infrastructure in the US
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
The executive order comes on the heels of the Biden administration’s proposed restrictions on exports of AI chips, an attempt to balance national security concerns about the technology with economic interests of producers and other countries.

The post Biden Signs Executive Order Aimed at Growing AI Infrastructure in the US appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: UK Considers Banning Ransomware Payment by Public Sector and CNI
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Since no technical means have been found to curtail criminal extortion through prevention or attack, the new proposal is to eliminate its profitability.

The post UK Considers Banning Ransomware Payment by Public Sector and CNI appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: WEF Report Reveals Growing Cyber Resilience Divide Between Public and Private Sectors
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
WEF's Global Cybersecurity Outlook 2025 report highlights key challenges like the skills gap, third-party risks, and resilience disparities between businesses and private sectors.

The post WEF Report Reveals Growing Cyber Resilience Divide Between Public and Private Sectors appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: BforeAI Raises $10 Million for Predictive Attack Intelligence
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
BforeAI has raised $10 million in Series B funding, which brings the total raised by the security firm to more than $30 million.

The post BforeAI Raises $10 Million for Predictive Attack Intelligence appeared first on SecurityWeek.
